edu.first.util

Class DriverstationInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.first.util.DriverstationInfo

  • public final class DriverstationInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all DriverStation static methods and other useful methods used for finding the status of the robot / DriverStation.

    Please note: This class is not the same as DriverStation. That is the direct link to the actual DriverStation. This is a convenience utility class with static methods referencing that class.

    Since:
    May 14 13

      • getDS

        public static DriverStation getDS()

        Returns:
        driverstation with all features

      • getIO

        Returns:
        an enhanced IO object for the advanced features of the driver station

        Returns:
        the team number

      • getPacketCount

        public static int getPacketCount()
        Return the DS packet number. The packet number is the index of this set of data returned by the driver station. Each time new data is received, the packet number (included with the sent data) is returned.
        Returns:
        the DS packet number.

      • FMSattached

        public static boolean FMSattached()
        Is the driver station attached to a Field Management System? Note: This does not work with the Blue DS.
        Returns:
        if the robot is competing on a field being controlled by a Field Management System

      • getBatteryVoltage

        public static double getBatteryVoltage()
        Read the battery voltage from the specified AnalogChannel.

        This method assumes that the battery voltage is being measured through the voltage divider on an analog breakout.

        Returns:
        the battery voltage.

      • getMatchTime

        public static double getMatchTime()
        Return the approximate match time. The FMS does not currently send the official match time to the robots. This returns the time since the enable signal sent from the Driver Station. At the beginning of autonomous, the time is reset to 0.0 seconds. At the beginning of teleoperated, the time is reset to +15.0 seconds. If the robot is disabled, this returns 0.0 seconds.

        USERMESSAGE: This is not an official time (so it cannot be used to argue with referees)

        Returns:
        match time in seconds since the beginning of autonomous

      • getGamePeriod

        public static java.lang.String getGamePeriod()
        Gets a string value of which game mode robot should be in.
        Returns:
        TELEOP, AUTONOMOUS or DISABLED.

      • isAutonomous

        public static boolean isAutonomous()
        Returns whether or not the DriverStation is currently in autonomous mode.

        if autonomous

      • isEnabled

        public static boolean isEnabled()

        Returns:
        if the robot is enabled

      • getAllianceName

        public static java.lang.String getAllianceName()
        The Alliance name.

        "Red", "Blue" or "invalid".

        Returns:
        Alliance name
